subject: Informatory signboards at project site.

Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No : 11041/21/2002-Admn: April 12, 2006 POLICY MATTERS: TECHNICAL 63 /2006 (Decision taken on Administration Division's note No. 11041/21/2002-Admn dated 27.03.2006) Sub Informatory signboards at project site ~reg It has been decided to install retro-reflective signboards at project sites containing the information regarding  section/stretch of National Highway to be fourlsix laned, length and target date of  completion. An illustrative   example of   the board is indicated below for reference_ NHAI Emblem GOI Emblem National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Shipping; Road Transport & Highways) Government of India Four laning Kottakatta-Kurnool Km 135-211 of NH 7 Length 75 km Completion by December 2008 2 The   signboard shall be retro reflective (of   high  intensity   grade as per  Ministry' $ specifications) with yellow background and black lettering: The information on each board shall be in one language only on the side facing the traffic The boards would be placed in such a way that distance between two boards on the same side is approximately 10-20 km: Minimum three such boards (in Regional language, Hindi and English) shall be provided for each package on both sides: The boards on opposite sides shall be suitably staggered. 3 The of the boards shall be as per IRC 67 (Code of Practice for Road Signs) . 4_ The size of the board may be 1.8 m (vertical) x 1.6 m (horizontal): 5_ The expenditure on putting up these boards may be met out of project contingencies. 6, All Project Directors are directed to install these signboard within 2 weeks and forward a compliance report: 7 This issues with the approval of Chairman, NHAI. (S K Pandey) Manager (Admn:) To AII Project Directors to PS to Chairman PS IPA to all Members MjUM NHAL siting Okfau8 Copy
